column1: númen is a noun meaning "west" in Quenya.
Image:Numen.gifNúmen is also the name in Quenya of the seventeenth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  It is the first letter of the fifth grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "nasal" consonants and it is the fifth letter in the dental or t-series of consonants
column3: the Tincotéma.  In most modes this letter represents N.  However
column7: footnote 2  Númen was one of the most widely known and used of all the Tengwar since it indicated "west" even in languages that used a very different term.  The Westron name for this letter is Nó.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme NDU plus MEN
